labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to provide real-time weather data and forecasts through a standardized interface using the Open-Meteo API. Its core functionality is to enable applications to query current weather conditions and related meteorological information, enhancing user experiences with accurate and up-to-date data. This aligns directly with weather-related services and data retrieval.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Weather" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around providing weather data. The secondary label "API Integration" is selected because the server uses the Open-Meteo API to fetch and process data, and no custom labels are needed as the predefined categories sufficiently describe the server's functionality.

tools.name: get_weather
tools.description: Get weather information using Open-Meteo API.

server_info_crawled.name: Weather Information Server
server_info_crawled.author: @AITutor3/weather-mcp2
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time weather data and forecasts through a standardized interface. Enable applications to query current weather conditions and related information seamlessly. Enhance user experiences by integrating accurate and up-to-date meteorological data.

tools.name: get_weather
tools.description: Get weather information using Open-Meteo API.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@AITutor3/weather-mcp2/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
